BR_text.BRsummary: [dashboard] Frequently getting `Cannot read property 'usedResources' of undefined` and blank screen
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
 Dashboard gets blank with Error:
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30770185/103917857-5e64fa00-510e-11eb-89ee-bfa6b31b1779.png></denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30770185/103917876-64f37180-510e-11eb-9c70-ce07c7fdb21a.png></denchmark-link>
 
 Complete log:
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ray-project/ray/files/5782810/172.31.1.103-1610037078818.log>172.31.1.103-1610037078818.log</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h4>System</denchmark-h>
 
 
 ray: 1.2.0.dev0
 python3.7
 NVIDIA-SMI 450.80.02    Driver Version: 450.80.02    CUDA Version: 11.0 GeForce GTX 1070
 ubuntu 18.04
 Chromium: Version 87.0.4280.66 (Official Build) Built on Ubuntu
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
 
 I am not yet able to reproduce this issue as it comes and goes, but it is kind of anoying, because you never know whan it comes back. I am actually not sure if it is a real severe issue -> I dont know that much about how the dashboard works internally but at least that case should be possible to prevent with adding ? behind coreWorkerStats[0], however not sure if that causes another error than at some other place...
 <denchmark-code>const WorkerGPU: WorkerFeatureRenderFn = ({ worker }) => {
 const workerRes = worker.coreWorkerStats[0].usedResources;
 const workerUsedGPUResources = workerRes?.["GPU"];
 </denchmark-code>
 
 If the code snippet cannot be run by itself, the issue will be closed with "needs-repro-script".
 
  I also saw this error before in a clean environment, but right now it happens on our test cluster
  I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.
 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mfitton>@mfitton</denchmark-link>
